A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Aside from having several of the main characters revert to stereotypes and tropes\, aside from cutting every tie to the Star Wars lore that made the other movies relevant to each other\, and aside from removing major villains without adequate explanations or satisfactory effort\, aside from several story arcs that do nothing to build the plot\, the film is just a drawn out if visually striking chase scene.
I watched it hoping that something would redeem the chauvinism and nihilism of the movie; not only was I not rewarded at the end\, I was punished.

As an isolated movie\, it's too long for just a chase scene and much of the plot us unnecessary. It is beautiful to watch.

As part of the saga this film ripped away my love for the franchise in a way that not even Jar Jar Binks could.  The movie said it hated what I loved\,  it hated me.  

I'm going to go watch "Solo"  again and hope that Mr. Abrams can provide adequate resolution/restitution.
